intro: Elatostema pellioniifolium, commonly known as the creeping buttercup, is a small herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Urticaceae and is characterized by its low-growing habit and dense clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant features opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Elatostema pellioniifolium is noted for its ability to form extensive mats, which help in soil stabilization and moisture retention.
